jobDescription: The Federal Reserve is looking for a highly talented, earnest, and motivated individual to join our Information Technology Services Department as a Project Analyst. The Project Analyst will be point person to ensure the development service’s team run smoothly. Primary Functions: Manage security of users On/Off boarding usersProcess security requests Manage Inventory Order hardware/softwareMaintain inventory listManage software licenses Manage Documentation Technical and processesComplianceCustomer/Partner information Manage Budget information Track the team’s budgetReport expendituresManage vendor invoices and related expense accounting items Manage timesheets Ensure staff is submitting timesheets on a weekly basisReview and approve timesheet submissionsTrack and report contractor spend to ensure proper funding and time commitments are metQualifications:Must be a U.S. citizen or a green carder holder with intent to become a U.S. CitizenStrong Excel skillsAdvanced interpersonal, business communication, and writing skillsCustomer focused with high quality standardsDemonstrated complex thinking, analysis, problem solving, and decision making skillsProficient with Microsoft Office productsQuick learnerDesirable Skills:Familiarity with Information Security practices or FISMAExperience with relational databasesKnowledge of the Federal Reserve SystemFamiliarity with Design Thinking The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our people proudly reflect the diversity and ideas of the communities we serve.
